intro: Lachenalia calcicola, commonly known as the rock lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces bright yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
